Description: Fragment of a faience vessel, complete profile preserved. Light green glaze inside and outside with a black geometrical decoration outside. Partly chipped on surface. The base is flat but is running down to the centre of the vessel, the edges at base and rim are protruding outwards slightly, getting thinner in the middle part of the wall. Flat rim with black decoration in form of a band. At the outer side a rectangle that is divided into four triangles, each having a black circle or oval dot. Left of the rectangle a vertical line.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Amara West (Nubia), Mound β, edge of town wall
